content.question: At a large university, data were collected on the number of sisters and brothers that each student had. Let the random variable <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></math> represent the number of sisters and the random variable <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the number of brothers. The distribution of <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has mean 1.00 and standard deviation 0.94. The distribution of <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has mean 1.07 and standard deviation 1.04. What is the mean of the distribution of <math alttext="X plus Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
